Type.Name: XmlReader
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents a reader that provides non-cached, forward-only access to XML data.

remarks.para: This class provides forward-only, read-only access to a stream of XML data. This class enforces the rules of well-formed XML but does not perform data validation.
This class conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations.

A given set of XML data is modeled as a tree of nodes. The different types of nodes are specified in the enumeration. The reader is advanced to the next node using the method. The current node refers to the node on which the reader is positioned. The following table lists the node properties exposed for the current node.

item.description: The number of attributes on the node.
The base URI of the node.
The depth of the node in the tree.
Whether the node has attributes.
Whether the node can have a text value.
Whether an node was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.
Whether an node is empty.
The local name of the node.
The qualified name of the node, equal to :.
The URI defining the namespace associated with the node.
The of the node.
A shorthand reference to the namespace associated with the node.
The quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute.
The text value of the node.
The xml:lang scope within which the node resides.

remarks.para: This class does not expand default attributes or general entities. Any general entities encountered are returned as a single empty node.
This class checks that a Document Type Definition (DTD) is well-formed, but does not validate using the DTD.
To read strongly typed data, use the class.

This class throws a on XML parse errors. After an exception is thrown, the state of the reader is not predictable. For example, the reported node type might be different than the actual node type of the current node.

block.para: This class is and implemented in the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 AttributeCount { public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname int32 get_AttributeCount() }
public abstract int AttributeCount { get; }

summary.para: Gets the number of attributes on the current node.

value.para: A containing the number of attributes on the current node, or zero if the current node does not support attributes.

para.block:
This property is only relevant to the , , and node types of the
enumeration. Other node types do not have attributes.
This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string BaseURI { public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname string get_BaseURI() }
public abstract string BaseURI { get; }

summary.para: Gets the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the current node.

value.para: The base URI of the current node.

para.block:
A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. DTD entities are an example of this, but this is not limited to DTDs. The base URI tells where these nodes come from. If there is no base URI for the nodes being returned (for example, they were parsed from an in-memory string),
is returned.
This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

summary.para:
Determines if a node containing content is an
node.

para.block: As described above.

This method calls the method, which determines whether the current node can contain content and, if not, moves the reader to the next content node or the end of the input stream. When the reader is positioned on a content node, the node is checked to determine if it is an node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to determine whether the node returned by the method is an node.

Docs.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

summary.para: Gets the qualified name of the current node.

value.para: A containing the qualified name of the current node or, for node types that do not have a name (like , , and so on), .

block.para:
The qualified name is equivalent to the
prefixed with and the ':' character. For example, is "bk:book" for the element <bk:book>.
The name returned is dependent on the of the node. The following node types return the listed values. All other node types return an empty string.

item.description: The name of the attribute.
The document type name.
The tag name.
The name of the entity referenced.
The target of the processing instruction.
The literal string "xml".

para.block: This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

value.para: A containing the namespace URI of the current node or, if no namespace URI is associated with the current node, .

block.para:
This property is relevant to and
nodes only.
Namespaces conform to the W3C "Namespaces in XML" recommendation, REC-xml-names-19990114.

para.block: This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

summary.para: Gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.

This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract bool Read()
public abstract bool Read ();

summary.para: Moves the position of the current instance to the next node in the stream, exposing its properties.

returns.para: A where indicates the node was read successfully, and indicates there were no more nodes to read.

para.block: As described above.
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality as described herein, as there is no default implementation.
When a reader is first created and initialized, there is no information available. Calling this method is required to read the first node.

Docs.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract bool ReadAttributeValue()
public abstract bool ReadAttributeValue ();

summary.para: Parses an attribute value into one or more , , and nodes.

returns.para: A where indicates the attribute value was parsed, and indicates the reader was not positioned on an attribute node or all the attribute values have been read.

block.para: To parse an node, call the method. After the node is parsed into child nodes, call the method again to read the value of the entity.

The of an attribute value node is one plus the depth of the attribute node. When general entity references are stepped into or out of, the
increments or decrements by one, respectively.

para.block: As described above.

Implementations that cannot expand general entities should return general entities as a single empty ( equals )
node.

Use this method after calling to read through the , or nodes that make up the attribute value. Call the method to resolve the
nodes.

summary.para: Reads the contents of a text-only element.

returns.para: A containing the contents of the element.

para.block: As described above.
This method calls the method and, if the returned node is an node, calls the method to read the contents.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to read the contents of a text-only element.

Docs.exception: The node is not an node, the element does not contain a simple text value, or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void ReadEndElement()
public virtual void ReadEndElement ();

summary.para: Reads an node and advances the reader to the next node.

para.block: As described above.

This method calls the method, which determines whether the current node can contain content and, if not, moves the reader to the next content node or the end of the input stream. The node the reader ends up positioned on is checked to determine if it is an node. If so, the node is read and the reader is moved to the next node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to read an node and advance the reader to the next node.

Docs.exception: The node is not an node or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string ReadInnerXml()
public virtual string ReadInnerXml ();

summary.para: Reads the contents of the current node, including child nodes and markup.

returns.para: A containing the XML content, or if the current node is neither an element nor attribute, or has no child nodes.

block.para: The current node and corresponding end node are not returned.
If the current node is an element, after the call to this method, the reader is positioned after the corresponding end element.
If the current node is an attribute, the position of the reader is not changed.
For a comparison between this method and the method, see .

para.block: This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

Docs.exception: The XML was not well-formed, or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string ReadOuterXml()
public virtual string ReadOuterXml ();

summary.para: Reads the current node and its contents, including child nodes and markup.

returns.para: A containing the XML content, or if the current node is neither an element nor attribute.

block.para: The current node and corresponding end node are returned.
If the current node is an element, after the call to this method, the reader is positioned after the corresponding end element.
If the current node is an attribute, the position of the reader is not changed.
For a comparison between this method and the method, see .

para.block: This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

Docs.exception: The XML was not well-formed, or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void ReadStartElement()
public virtual void ReadStartElement ();

summary.para: Reads an node and advances the reader to the next node.

para.block: As described above.

This method calls the method, which determines whether the current node can contain content and, if not, moves the reader to the next content node or the end of the input stream. The node the reader ends up positioned on is checked to determine if it is an node. If so, the node is read and the reader is moved to the next node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to read an node and advance the reader to the next node.

Docs.exception: The node is not an node or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void ReadStartElement(string name)
public virtual void ReadStartElement (string name);

Docs.param: A specifying the qualified name of an element.

summary.para: Reads an node with the specified qualified name and advances the reader to the next node.

para.block: As described above.

This method calls the method and, if the returned node is an node, compares the property of the node to . If they are equal, this method calls the method to read the element and move to the next node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to read an node with the specified qualified name, and advance the reader to the next node.

Docs.exception: The node is not an node, the property of the node does not equal , or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

public virtual void ReadStartElement (string localName, string namespaceName);

summary.para: Reads an node with the specified local name and namespace URI and advances the reader to the next node.

para.block: As described above.

This method calls the method. If the returned node is an node, this method compares the and properties of the node to and , respectively. If they are equal, this method calls the method to read the element and move to the next node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to read an node with the specified local name and namespace URI, and advance the reader to the next node.

Docs.exception: The node is not an node, the property of the node does not equal , the property of the node does not equal , or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract string ReadString()
public virtual string ReadString ();

summary.para: Reads the contents of an element or text node as a string.

returns.para: A containing the contents of the or node, or if the reader is positioned on any other type of node.

block.para:
If positioned on an node, this method concatenates all , , , and node types, and returns the concatenated data as the element content. If none of these node types exist,
is returned. Concatenation stops when any markup is encountered, which can occur in a mixed content model or when an element end tag is read.

If positioned on an element node, this method performs the same concatenation from the node to the element end tag. If the reader is positioned on an attribute node, this method has the same functionality as if the reader were position on the element start tag.

para.block: This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

Docs.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

.method public hidebysig virtual abstract void ResolveEntity()
public abstract void ResolveEntity ();

summary.para: Resolves the entity reference for nodes.

block.para:
This method parses the entity reference into child nodes. When the parsing is finished a new node is placed in the stream to close the
scope. To step into the entity after this method has been called, call the method if the entity is part of an attribute value, or the method if the entity is part of element content.
If this method is not called, the parser moves to the next node past the entity (child nodes are bypassed).
This method must be overridden in order to provide the functionality as described in the Behaviors and Usage sections, as there is no default implementation.
This method is required to throw an exception for implementations that do not support schema or DTD information. In this case, the property is required to return .

para.block: Use this method to resolve the entity reference for nodes. Before calling this method, determine whether the reader can resolve an entity by checking the property.

Docs.exception: The reader is not positioned on a node.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Xml.Schema.IXmlSchemaInfo SchemaInfo { get; }
public virtual System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings Settings { get; }
.method public hidebysig virtual void Skip()
public virtual void Skip ();

summary.para: Skips over the current element and moves the position of the current instance to the next node in the stream.

para.block:
If the reader is positioned on a non-empty node ( equals ), the position of the reader is moved to the node following the corresponding node. The properties of the nodes that are skipped over are not exposed. If the reader is positioned on any other node type, the position of the reader is moved to the next node, in this case behaving like the
method.
This method calls the method before skipping to the next node.
Override this method to customize the behavior of this method in types derived from the class.
Use this method to skip over the current node.

Docs.exception: The XML was not well-formed, or an error occurred while parsing the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: void IDisposable.Dispose ();
.property string Value { public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname string get_Value() }
public abstract string Value { get; }

summary.para: Gets the text value of the current node.

value.para: A containing the text value of the current node.

block.para: The value returned depends on the . The following table lists node types that have a value to return. All other node types return .

item.description: The value of the attribute.
The content of the CDATA section.
The content of the comment.
The internal subset.
The entire content, excluding the target.
The white space between markup in a mixed content model, or in the scope of xml:space = "preserve".

description.para: The content of the text node.

item.description: The white space between markup.
The content of the declaration.

para.block: This property must be overridden in order to provide the functionality described above, as there is no default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Type ValueType { get; }
